newsitem.title: PERU: Peru Congress to investigate phone scandal.
newsitem.headline: Peru Congress to investigate phone scandal.

text.p: Peru's Congress decided on Friday to hold its own inquiry into alleged telephone tapping by secret service agents despite the fact the government ordered a special public prosecutor to investigate the scandal.

The prosecutor appointed to handle the case, Victor Salvatierra, has promised impartiality, but opposition legislators complained the investigator was hand-picked by the government and pushed for a Congress-based inquiry.
The allegations surfaced in July when a local television station aired a report accusing the secret services of tapping the telephones of 197 politicians, journalists, artists and businessmen.

Former United Nations chief Javier Perez de Cuellar aggravated the scandal on Tuesday by saying he would lodge formal charges that security forces were involved in tapping his telephones during the 1995 presidential campaign.
Perez de Cuellar, who leads Peru's opposition, lost the election to President Alberto Fujimori.
